author: svn-role
msg: Remove the '1.8.x-memory-fragmentation' branch, merged in r1701345.

author: svn-role
msg: Merge the 1.8.x-memory-fragmentation branch:
* ^/subversion/branches/1.8.x-memory-fragmentation
Reduce FSFS memory allocation in Apache with unbounded MaxFreeMem.
Justification:
A user reported that their worker processes ran OOM with Apache 2.2
in default configuration when fulltext caching was enabled. Although
people should set MaxFreeMem to something other than 0, we should
play nice with out-of-the-box setups.
The patch itself is relatively low-risk (changes initial buffer size).
Votes:
+1: stefan2, brane, rhuijben

author: pfg
msg: FreeBSD-10 fixes
Some old configuration scripts confuse FreeBSD-10 with FreeBSD-1.0. On
regular FreeBSD port builds these had no visible effect since it's logical
to use up-to-date external dependencies but, in the case of the buildbot,
these were likely to be the culprits behind breakage.
Huge thanks for the reporter for working these out!
Submitted by:	Don Lewis
